intro: Uropappus leucocarpus, commonly known as white fruit sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually gray-green, covered in fine hairs, and adapted to arid environments. Uropappus leucocarpus is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well-suited for xeriscaping.
